reviewText:
I have repeatedly found spore to entertain me in so many different ways, whether I laugh, or smile, or I am just plain satisfied

The cell phase is like the game Feeding Frenzy, which leaves me bias because I was addicted to that game for over a year(don't judge). At  times, you are the bottom of the food chain, but eat enough, and you can get that satisfying feeling of eating thoses who tried to eat you. Like I said, Feeding Frenzy.

The creature phase is a lot of fun, simply because you can make your character anything you want, and it still looks ridiculous. It also offers the choice: Aggressive or Social, letting you play your way(as a personal preference, I go neutral).

The tribal stage is by far my least favorite, but that's personal preference. It plays like starcraft, where you select a group and lead them somewhere by clicking.

The civilization phase is where decisions have to be made: Will you ally with the red city, or take them over for their resources. It causes quick thinking, and I love it.

The space phase is immensly fun and funny, wherther it's an alien race offering you an umbrella, or the worshippers of Spode, or the voice acting" (If you can call it that) Buying galactic adventures adds more to the Space phase
date: but it's still tons of fun without it.\n\nThe only bugs I've run into are some graphical glitches
recommended: which I assume are caused by the shape of my creature.\n\nAll in all
hoursPlayed: I would say that this game is a must buy."

reviewText: I find this to be a rather fun and interesting game. If you're not patient enough to sit and try to find all the different parts, you can go from single celled organism to space age in less than 3 hours. But once you hit that final stage there is so much to do. It has blown my mind, between the species evolution,  to the different societal  choices. It's fun, and it's goofy, and the way you play can vary from person to person.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText: I usually dislike RTS games but Spore is different in my opinion, I abosolutly LOVE how crazy and goofy you can get with your creations! You start from the cell stage and work your way up to creature, tribal, civil, and space. I found that I much prefer the Creature stage mostly because you can be the animal, stalk your pray (if your a meat eater), tear into their flesh and all that good stuff. I just really enjoy being a savage animal. Once you go into the Tribal stage thats when the RTS part of Spore comes in and some people prefer that but like I said I just enjoy being a savage creature killing anything that isn't my own!\n\n9/10

reviewText:
IF YOU HAVE PROBLEMS RUNNING SPORE:

Go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Spore" and find the file called "runme.exe". Right click it and set the compatibility mode to Windows XP SP2.
Now go to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Spore\SporeBin" and find "SporeApp.exe" - do the same
date: set the compatibility mode to WinXP SP2.\n\nThis should now work. I didn't have to do anything on my Windows 10 x64 machine
recommended:
but I had to do this for my gf's Win8 machine because nothing else would work.

Hope this helps!

Otherwise - the game is very fun :)"

reviewText:
Don't take it from the time I've spent playing this on Steam, I've played this game for hundreds of hours since it originally came out. Now, this game got a lot of flak because it didn't meet the standards the trailer left for it. Now, while this is true, I still think it was great for what it is worth. A lot of the games feel like minigames, that is true, but it is still a lot of fun, especially once you reach the Space Stage. Traveling the entire galaxy is something I have always wanted from a game.

As well, I have spent hours simply creating new creatures; it's so fun!

I'd say this game is worth your money, despite what you would hear.

reviewText: Do you want a creature with mouths for hands? Or maybe a creature with huge arms and tiny legs? Spore is not limited by the ever-present boundaries of physics or common sense, and even in the later game where you can no longer evolve your creature physically, visiting other planets to find that 8-nosed monstrosity you made as a joke living in harmony with 'normal' creatures is great fun. Truly a masterpiece of a game.

reviewText: Spore is a game that combines games. It does so while keeping the same element that binds together all these playstyles. You create your own- WOAH. To understand Spore's key element, you need to take a look at EVERYTHING it has to offer. You begin emerging from a meteor as a cell, where you swim around the Tidepool searching for food. Depending on what you are (carnivore or herbivore) you eat different creatures, food, and other things. eating gives you DNA, the currency that lets you change up your cell in a way that gives it protection, speed, and tricks. These tricks can then be used during the creature stage, which is where youwalk around the surface of the planet (you get to name it, too!) finding food. Other creatures inhabit the land too, though. You have two options: Friend, or food. You unlock HUNDREDS of new partss to use on your creature, including pincers, cooler eyes and mouths, arms, legs, and the list goes on. afterwards you are trested to the Tribal Stages. Here you select units (which are your own creature army) and tell them where to go. Now you can't change the look of your creature, or even RENAME them. All you can do now is give him some odd looking tribal clothes. Other tribes steal your food (new currency), and it gets pretty hectic. Tribal isn't as good, but its short and brings you to Civilization stage. Here your creature has built towns, trade routes, tanks and fighter jets, designed by YOU. Once again, selected unit-based gameplay, but its more fun than Tribal. i just find it fun to send my army to a small town ready to be conquered. As for the Space Stage, you now control your designed spaceship to conquer or ally other planets. Spore gets a 10/10.

reviewText: I LOVE SPORE! this game is like none other I have ever played before! when you makeyour creature in spore, you get this caring feeling to help your creature in situations and help your creature involve as well. you want to watch it get more powerful as your being goes through multiple stages of 'being the better being'. it is also fun to see where your creature ranks in the stages, like whether your lifeform is agressive or not. one complant i do have is the space stage: that feeling of helping your creature envolve 'dissapears' in this stage! in the space stage you will often do missions for other races to get more loot, instead of getting sed loot for something that helps your race in more of a way than getting some loot! plus, even claming places or destroying enemy colonies are harder in this stage than any other, in so many ways! the rest of the game is wonderful and I do recomend it very much!

reviewText:
IF YOU HAVE PROBLEMS RUNNING SPORE:

Go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Spore" and find the file called "runme.exe". Right click it and set the compatibility mode to Windows XP SP2.
Now go to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Spore\SporeBin" and find "SporeApp.exe" - do the same
date: set the compatibility mode to WinXP SP2.\n\nThis should now work. I didn't have to do anything on my Windows 10 x64 machine
recommended:
but I had to do this for my gf's Win8 machine because nothing else would work.

Hope this helps!

Otherwise - the game is very fun :)"

reviewText: Spore is a very great game i personally before i got the game i watched around 10 diffrent series on this game such as TerasHD, DanTDM, Aphmou, Mousie, LittleLizardGaming, Bdoubleoo100 and GenerickB. Teras having 5 different series on spore. I've played for nearly 23 hours at the time of creating this and its still entertaining. On the modded side of things the creepy and cute parts pack is not a necesity but its nice to have some lttle peices to have being a cheap-ish price its fine, the Galactic Adventures mod is a must get, after you've played the space stage for a while its a great addition, luckly for me i was able to buy this game for a low price due to the 75% Christmas Discount. I believe this game is well worth the money sadly the error in spore servers makes you opptionally go through a long series of steps to go online, the game overall is great fun and the creativity is too, the player input in to the game is outstanding. At this time Spore is most likely my favourite game. Good bye and good gaming!

reviewText:
This game is the most glorious product of human technology I have seen in my life. Its an organism's progression, from single-celled to galactic empire, except you control it the whole way through. The creator is essentially made of options. Maxis really went out of their way to make sure there was a diverse pool of creatures to encounter throughout the game.
I give spore 9.99999 out of 10.

PS: when you unlock tribal stage, evolve one more time and make it look as cool as possible regardless of stats; they don't really affect anything after you finish creature stage.

reviewText: There isn't a whole lot about this game I can say that hasn't been said already. I got this game back in 2010 by retail, and I immediately fell in love with it. The level of creativity in it is amazing, it's funny at times, and has decent replayability. It really allows your mind to wander, and create your own little world. Not to mention it can be difficult at times on the hardest difficulty. The expansion pack Galactic Adventures really added some much needed flavor to the gameplay. I could continue to regurgitate praise for the game (And trust me, it is a great game worthy of the praise it gets) but I felt some things needed to be changed. First off, if they ever created a second spore, they need to add an aquatic/fish stage. That would really lengthen the game and please a lot of fans. While this was on my mind, it was never a big problem for me personally. The big gripe I have with this game is the Space Stage. When I first got to space stage, I was incredibly excited. You are instantly allowed (except for the boring intro tutorial) to wander around and explore this vast universe filled with alien life. You got to find wormholes, explore planets, find aliens, kill aliens, etc... For someone who is really in love with space, I explored every solar system I could get to. However, after exploring for a bit, I noticed that every one of the solar systems is almost the same. I'm not talking about the way they look. Cosmetically, each system can vary from cookie-cutter to extremely unique, as do the planets. But gameplay wise, there wasn't a whole lot of new stuff. Again, Galactic Adventures changed this a little bit, but not entirely. Being the last stage of the game, I felt like it kinda gave up at the end. They could have done so much more with space stage! Now, I know trying to create 100,000 different solar systems is near impossible and time consuming, but I feel like a little more flavor would have been nice. The other thing I saw wrong with space stage was the Grox. The Grox can first show up all the way in creature stage, and the intro into space stage sets them up as a terrifying advanced race bent on destroying all. And that's exactly what they are. When I went to war with these things, I was determined to obliterate them. But no. Their empire is HUGE. About 2400 systems. Again, I know they are supposed to be this invincible empire, which they almost are, but this makes fighting them fun and challenging to just boring... Same thing. Bomb the planet while avoiding space crafts. Move to next planet. Do the same thing over. Even if you cheat, it takes forever. Not to mention it's almost impossible to remain neutral with them. Even if you don't bother them, your allies get attacked, requiring you to fight them off. It's such a hassel. And the worst part is that when you finally take over all 2400 systems, what are you rewarded with? A new weapon? Access to a planet creator? Boosted relations with all alien empires? No. You get an in game medal, and bragging rights. It's just not enough. However, despite all this criticizm, this game is amazing. If you are a person who loves sci-fi, or just loves to make things, give this game a look. It's definately worth the price. 8/10

reviewText: Spore is a game where you evolve a species from a tiny cell (Microbe) into a space dwelling empire, a great concept, and overall, a great game! I played Spore quite a while back, right when it came out, I played it for hours on end. I decided to come back to it 3 years later, and wow, it's still a really addicting game, (44 hours? That's not much. Well, I've played on the Creepy And Cute expansion for a lot more) they include multiple types of gameplay, as in Cell stage, you work your way up and grow by eating until you are large enough to walk onto the shore. Creature stage is slightly different, as it's a bit more open world with more options and possibilities. You can either socialize or hunt down creatures in a nest. Creature stage also opens up to the Creature creator, with far more parts then Cell stage that will help you adapt and survive to eventually make it to the top, eventually leading you to Tribal Stage. In this Stage, you take control of your tribe members, socializing or killing off other competing tribes. Tribal stage also leads to equipment to put on your creatures. Once you defeat or ally with 6 of the tribes, you head off to Civilization stage with 3 unique ways of gameplay. This stage you take control of cities, by either capturing them with military might, buying them with trade routes, paying them enough for them to eventually ally with you, or forcing your peaceful beliefs on cities. This is where Spice begins to take an important role, when you capture these spice geysers, it gives you income, which allows you to build your cities and create vehicles. Once you get world domination, it leads you to a casual Space sandbox. This game is all around a really amazing game, I have to give it a good 9/10. Totally worth the money.

reviewText:
------------------------------------------------------------------

满满的童年，大赞。

------------------------------------------------------------------

汉化游戏方法以及游戏内登陆EA帐号方法：

下载游戏后，先打官方繁中补丁，可以完美兼容DLC（银河大冒险和皮肤包）。

然后打开/下载origin，将游戏和两个DLC的序列号输入到EA帐号里，添加游戏。

所有游戏和DLC的设置启动选项加入一段这样的语句：-locale:zh-tw

运行游戏，登陆EA的橘子帐号。

成功一次即可永久解决了。

------------------------------------------------------------------

登陆橘子帐号后，可以看到好多好多的玩家分享的模型，各种趣怪的生物，蛮有意思的。

------------------------------------------------------------------

从此之后这就是一款从一个小细胞发展，到侵略宇宙中心的伟大游戏了，233333333333333333

。

reviewText:
I first started playng this game when I was ten or eleven and I still love it. This is one of the games I grew on. Yes, it does not have a wonderfull graphics or breathtaking action (actually it does) but this is a really good game. Kids can spend hours playing it, adulst will enjoy it's madness or simply make a ♥♥♥♥-like creature.
I highly recommend it to young gamers.

The creature redactor is wonderfull. Make anything your heart desires and it will still look and move fine.
The sounds, the music are great. Feel the atmosphere of new-born life and the beauty of space.
Enjoy silly jokes while trading alien races :)
Meet an Unidentified Walking Objects made by other users while playing. Some things they build are hilarious.
You will have an ability to take over the whole galaxy. Is'n it awesome to be an overlord?
It is easier to play as a peacefull creature. Be good.


Disadvantages are:
Sometimes the game does not work. :D
It is hard to beat it only for the first time. Try to find out everything by yourself so the game would be more interesting.
Space stage is completely boring without Galactic Adventures. With GA it is just a little less boring.
Too easy to understand how the game works. The interaction with animals/tribes/civilisations is too predictable.

reviewText:
This game allows me to shape a species in the way that the Flying Spaghetti Monster and the Invisible Pink Unicorn shaped us, in the beginning days,

In this game i am a God, i am a Devil, i create warmongerers, i create peacekeepers, i conquer the galaxy, i destroy other races that threaten my chosen people, i dictate that my creations must evolve to survive, and it is my hand that shapes their bodies and minds.

Of course, none of that happened in real life, because if a God shaped us, i'd imagine we'd look way cooler.

Like, horns and stuff.

Yeah.

reviewText: I going to be very direct and honest here. Simply put, God gave the gifts of imagination and creativity to all Mankind. These happen to be two of my favorite gifts that God gave us. Spore happens to be a game that allows for alot of creativity and imagination on the part of the player!!! That in itself makes the game awesome!!! There are an incredible amount of options for creating your own race of creatures and the creativity does not stop there. You can design all your buildings as well as all your vehicles (land vehicles, boats, flying machines such as helicopters, airplanes, spaceships and any other flying devices you can think of.), you can decide which plants and animals will be placed on which planet for them to inhabit. You can also terraform any planet in pratically everyway!!! You can raise or lower the land, change the atmosphere and even change the color of the sky of each planet!!! Now I could go on forever about the creativity of the game, but I really need to mention that the play control is excellent and more importantly the gameplay is truly excellent!!! I'll finish by saying that Spore is not only my favorite game of all time, but I also believe that Spore is currently THE BEST GAME OF ALL TIME!!!\n

reviewText: Spore is a unique game. It lets you create your own species and evolve them from microscopic cells, to a space-fairing empire. As you go along each stage, you get to use a powerful editor that lets you create virtualy anything you want. You could create something out of Mass Effect or Halo, or whatever you want. Imagination is the limit! When not in the editors, you will be spending time in Spore's 5 different stages. Each stage has its own kind of gameplay, giving you different genres of playstyle. I enjoyed all of the stages, but thre were a few problems I had. The lack of an auto save feature can be annoying at times. The gme sometimes crashes and  when I forget to save, I lose alot or all progress. (So remember to save) Another problem I had was in tribal stage were my tribe's men wouldn't harvest meat from hunting. (This wasn't too big a deal, I just restarted the game and it was fixed) There are a few bugs here and there, but they shouldn't be gamebreaking. Overall, this is one of my favorite games. (If you like this game, be sure to heck out it's other awesome dlcs.)

reviewText:
I cannot recommend this game in it's current state. It will freeze up and crash on me every 30 to 90 minutes. I've done the end of the creature stage 4 times now and the beginning of the tribal stage 2 to 3 times. I've finally realized that I need to just save it every 10 minutes, but it is very frustrating.

For the actual gameplay, it is an incredible game. The process and method used to develop your species is absolutely phenonmenal and I am loving it thus far. I cannot wait to get to the end of the tribal stage and grow into an almighty civilization. I have no doubt it will be a lot of fun when I get there, but I hate the fact that this game freezes and crashes so often with no error message or anything of the nature.

I want to recommend this game so badly as it is built so well, but the crashes are too huge a turn off for me.

reviewText: Although I didn't think I would like this game much, I am a Maxis fangirl at heart. The truth is, from Cell stage right up to Space stage is ridiculously fun. Gameplay is a bit repetitive, and the controls can sometimes make you want to tear your hair out, but, overall the different stages keep things interesting right up until the end. In my opinion, Space stage is the least fun with it's running all around the galaxy trying to do missions and make trades. If you're looking for a fun game that you can pretty much play Cell stage to Space stage in a sitting or two, this will keep you entertained. The quirky mannerisms of the creatures (in pure maxis fashion) will make you giggle, and the customization is pretty fun too!

reviewText:
Program reputation for reliability - 6
Fun - 9
Replay - 9 (I think the games gameplay-variety is responsible for such high replayability, but just low-effort guess)
Depth - 8 (with lots of collecting, achievements, items, and parts thrown ontop of an already lengthy game, lots to do)
Graphics - 7 (given the style, it hasn't aged poorly and is still easy on the eyes)
Audio - 7 (quite good! and often pretty cute/disturbing as well)
UI Ease - 6 (Some game mechanics are a little uncooperative and once identified, have to be in turn used against the AI. space combat comes to mind as does land-creature movement and tribal group and order management)

reviewText: Hello guys welcome to another recommended vid- NO i mean.. yeah... anyways today its spore! This is a game where you can create your own... creature? Yes! You can make it how you like! A thing that has 10 legs? Sure! A snake with no legs and thousands of arms? Why not! Even a alive ♥♥♥♥ that has hairs and that is O.P with fighting... Anyway you have this 5 stages! Cell stage, creature stage, tribal stage, civilization stage and space stage! Lets start with cell stage.. In cell stage you are a weird bacteria in a water maze you need to eat to grow... yes and break rocks for new parts to customisize your creature cell bacteria whatever! Then you have creature stage when you finally get a brain you can unlock this stage! litteraly! Once again eat to survive carnivore or herbivore or both! Yes.... meet other creatures find dead things to get parts on it that it doesnt even have! And these O.P giant ♥♥♥ monsters that kill you in one hit..... EPIC MONSTERS yes that is their name.... Then you have tribal stage when your brain is fully grown you unlock this *WARNING THIS IS A RAGE AND BORING STAGE* (at least for me) No in this stage you dont need food to survive but to create random babies with it that become members of ur small verry legit town! Sounds legit... right? be ally with them by using music or kill and murder other villages by using painfully spears! Torches! Or stone axes! When you kill every not dumb tribal members in ur world u can elvolve to civilization stage.... LETS START THE WAR! i say in this stage its all about WAR Be: military you need to capture cities if u are this (you get military by being mostly aggresive in cell stage, creature stage and tribal stage) Religious! You need to be friendly for this you fight with music ♥♥♥♥! And economic you need to be friendly and aggresive for this You ally others and give them gifts to begin a trade route and when that is all over you can buy the city! Yes.... When  u have all the cities u elvolve to... SPACE STAGE (the most awesome hardest longest and the most fun stage of all! Be ready to create your own spaceship and explore the whole MILKYWAY!! There are 10 kind of classes with their own special ability (depends of how you did in the stages before) colonisize planets start wars! make allies! do missions! And.... The evil... Of the milky way...... find out and buy this awesome game of creature making this is the most awesome dumb funny weirdest game ever! Or the most weirdest funniest! dumbest awesome game ever! STARRING: METEOR RAINS PLANETS THE MILKY WAY FLESH FRUIT WEIRD CREATURES DUMB CREATURES FUNNY CREATURES AWESOME CREATURES RULING THE MILKY WAY ANNOYING LONG WARS MAKING ALLIES THE EVIL OF THE MILKY WAR SPORE!!!!!! 10/10 creature making thing game best of the best! GET IT NAOW

reviewText: Spore is a unique game. It lets you create your own species and evolve them from microscopic cells, to a space-fairing empire. As you go along each stage, you get to use a powerful editor that lets you create virtualy anything you want. You could create something out of Mass Effect or Halo, or whatever you want. Imagination is the limit! When not in the editors, you will be spending time in Spore's 5 different stages. Each stage has its own kind of gameplay, giving you different genres of playstyle. I enjoyed all of the stages, but thre were a few problems I had. The lack of an auto save feature can be annoying at times. The gme sometimes crashes and  when I forget to save, I lose alot or all progress. (So remember to save) Another problem I had was in tribal stage were my tribe's men wouldn't harvest meat from hunting. (This wasn't too big a deal, I just restarted the game and it was fixed) There are a few bugs here and there, but they shouldn't be gamebreaking. Overall, this is one of my favorite games. (If you like this game, be sure to heck out it's other awesome dlcs.)

column19: but the DRM was just shoddily integrated and really said "We're EA and we don't really give a flying ♥♥♥♥". When your "most anticipated game" gets spotlight as the most pirated game ever
column20: you know you did something horribly wrong. Also
column21: you were only allowed to install 3 times once upon a time and the DRM was the largest reason why the game got 1 star on Amazon. Anyway
column22: I'm beating a dead horse that was festering for about 6 years or so
column23: but it was a noticeable point in Spore's history
column24: and I don't put that term in a good way.\n\nSpore is
column26: a decently aged game. I wouldn't recommend it at 20$ right now

reviewText: Spore is a unique game where you start off as a cell and work your way up to the King of the Universe. Not many games are like that. Each phase allows a unique experience and the expansion packs augment this adventure. The gameplay or style may not be for everyone, but it is certainly worth picking up. In conclusion, you won't buy one game; you'll buy five--or six if you get the expansions

reviewText:
Despite being released in 2008, this game still rivals even new releases. I've been a huge fan of Spore since I first played it in 2010, and am still dumbfounded by the level of creativity of some of the community's creations.

Some people seem to be having issues with their Steam Key not being verified correctly when signing up for online. I too had this problem. Thankfully I had my old account to fall back on, but I do reccomend that you look into this issue before purchasing the game. The community aspect of this game is what really makes it shine, and the game suffers somewhat without it.

This game has serious replayability, and the exploration aspect is mindblowing. You can explore an entire galaxy full of stars, the vast majority of which have orbiting planets, some of which have moons. Alongside this, the space stage has a number of beautiful features such as binary systems, black holes, protoplanetary systems, a stunning galactic core, cube planets, and the elusive storybook planets. There are also many others including easter eggs (finding Earth, for example).

Each stage is as good as the previous, and the level of customisation is mindblowing. For this price, everyone should be buying this game... Well, I'd be saying that if online worked for everyone.

reviewText: The company who made this game also made the sims. This is an attempt to branch off, and is a good try. Will this game ever mesure up to the sims? reviewText: Spore is a very special type of game. You start as a cellular organism, and build your way up to traveling around IN SPACE. If you have a very creative mind, you NEED to play Spore. Everything about your organism is customizable, and it makes for a lot of fun. I find myself just making new creatures just to see how cool they look. I mean, who wouldn't want a huge duck billed purple dragon creation that sings? I did that. And it was glorious. What I also like about the game is that you can interact with other creatures that people have made and uploaded. But just be warned. There's a lot of ♥♥♥♥♥ organsisms. So be prepared. But besides that, I would recommend this game to anyone! I mean the cell stage and creature stage act like action-adventure games, and the tribal to space evolutions are more like strategy games! What's not to love? Go make your own abominations of mankind today!!!

Game worth trying because it's genre's classic, but in a long run it could be interesting for kids only. It's pretty anti-scientific however and can't used to learn things about nature :)

reviewText:
Spore... Spore is an excellent concept, but the excecution is quite poor.

The original idea could have been a masterpiece. The game changed for the worse, but still remains a half decent game, that I would certainly recommend buying, in a sale.  The creature design makes the game. It makes a ruined concept good. We have people making amazing things,  but if you want an anteater slug that can't defend itself, or a treeperson, then that can be done too.

Buy this game at £15 if you want. But when it's cheaper, just buy it straight away.
